column4: sushiX:try  "gnome-session-properties" in the terminal and see what errors it spits out
it says could not connect to the session manager
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gnome-session/+bug/237872 seems to have the same problem
one solution was to delete the ~/.kde diretory, but I cna't figure out why that would work. Try it anyway, other wise kill X ctrl alt bkspc and see if it still happens
